title: Hacking the Global Telecommunications Network
historical_context: This article was written during a time when telecommunications networks were becoming increasingly complex and accessible, providing a unique insight into the early days of hacking into corporate networks.
target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, security professionals, and those interested in telecommunications.
short_summary: The article details the sign-on procedures and commands for accessing Citibank's Global Telecommunications Network (GTN), highlighting two distinct types of user commands and troubleshooting tips for potential issues.
summary: The Kurgan also shares practical advice for users encountering difficulties, suggesting that pretending to be a Citibank employee can yield helpful responses from customer support. This article serves as a historical document, reflecting the hacker ethos of the time, where knowledge of network systems was a powerful tool for exploration and exploitation. The inclusion of dial-up numbers and service addresses further illustrates the accessibility of such networks, making it a valuable resource for aspiring hackers and security professionals interested in the evolution of telecommunications hacking.
